casebody.data:
James Rogers, Respondent v. James McGay, Impleaded, Appellant. Decided April 15, 1889. Appeal from a judgment in favor of plaintiff. Hastings & Southworth, for appellant. James A. Deering, for respondent.

Before Sedgwick, Ch. J., Truax and Dugro, JJ.

This appeal involved only a question of fact. The Court held (Dugro, J., writing, Sedgwick, Ch. J., and Truax, J., concurring) “ that the judgment should be affirmed.”
